meanings.definition: A person, typically one more remote than a grandparent, from whom one is descended.
meanings.sent1: My ancestors came from a faraway land.
meanings.sent2: I often think about my ancestors and their way of life.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if my ancestors would have approved of my modern gadgets.
meanings.sent4: The roots of our family tree run deep with the stories of our ancestors.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the old family house always fills me with a sense of connection to my ancestors.

meanings.definition: Something that originates or comes from a particular source.
meanings.sent1: The recipe for this dish has its origins in the culinary practices of our ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The traditions we follow today are passed down from our ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The antique vase in the attic is a treasure from our ancestors.
meanings.sent4: The river, the lifeblood of the village, is the ancestor of our prosperity.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll is an ancestor of the modern book, preserving knowledge through the ages.
